column3: Oops, looks like #7062 was in fact already backported. So this probably should be, but maybe too late...\n

Since most users don't, I believe, use prioritisetransaction, I don't think the name change matters at all, though I would have been happy to change it to be more acceptable during the review of #7062.\n\nSeems way too late in the 0.12 release cycle to bike shed the rpc field, and I don't think we should only make the change in master and needlessly introduce incompatibility between the about-to-b

I'm indifferent to this too, weak NACK.

The mempool code is still in flux, and this is an internal implementation detail that is exposed, next release there may have been changes again. Bike shedding on naming is just a waste of time.
